alert.note: Alert for Osceola (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 14 at 5:08PM EDT by NWS Melbourne
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northern Osceola County through 545 PM EDT... At 508 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 9 miles southwest of Harmony, or 10 miles southwest of Holopaw, moving northwest at 20 mph. Additional strong storms will develop across northern Osceola County through late afternoon. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Saint Cloud, East Lake Toho, Holopaw, West Lake Toho and Narcoossee. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or hard-topped vehicle. Remember, when thunder roars, go indoors!
